reviews.review: Best game ever made!

Gordon Freeman has the same name as Commissioner Gordon from Batman.
Batman's enemy is the Joker.
Jokers act in circuses.
Circuses have animals.
A cat is an animal.
Cat has 9 lives.
Square root of 9 is 3.

Un clásico de los FPS, de los juegos para PC y de los videojuegos en general. Un juego que todo gamer debiera jugar.

Как прошел эту замечательную игру,сразу же решил написать обзор.Читаем:
Что ж,скажу вам,что здесь нет захватывающего сюжета,красивой графики,интересных диалогов,множества персонажев,НО
все это закрывает сама игра.Когда ты начинаешь играть,тебе становится все по барабану и ты просто идешь вперед убивая людей и монстров и интрес к игре остается на протяжении всей истории.Игра затягивает полностью и ты играешь в нее с интересом до последней минуты!
Боссы,куча разнообразного оружия,враги и приятные головолмки!Все это Hilf-Life!!!
Эту игру должен пройти каждый уважающий себя геймер,поэтому покупайте и наслаждайтесь.
P.S   Ну и конечно же хедкрабы :3

Half-Life if Valve's first ever video game, and while the graphics today look like total crap, what really makes this game shine is the atmosphere you get from playing it. I can't tell you how many times I felt like I was actually Gordon Freeman, fighting creatures in Black Mesa! It's also home of some of Valve's best compositions, right up there with things like CP Violation and Rocket Jump Waltz.

Second to none in the FPS genre. A must own for any gamer.
Still Holds up amazingly well, even by today's standards.
Thanks to this game Valve is where it is. So imagine, after so many years remains good game.

EXCELLENT
I did not play this until 2012 and was worried it would be "too old".
I am glad i was wrong, this game is still fantastic today (2015).

Challenging puzzles, ok story (for its time) and plays fine on any machine.
Runs perfect at 4K eve with Nvidia DSR.

Highly recommend any PC Games play this title.

전설의 게임 하프 라이프! 3가 나오지 않는다는 전설의 게임입니다.
우선 90년대에 나온 작품인 만큼, 그래픽은 기대를 하면 안 됩니다. 하지만 게임을 플레이하는 데에는 전혀 지장이 없습니다. 그만큼 매력적인 게임이지요.
그리고 스토리도 마음에 들었습니다. 하프 라이프 시리즈를 처음 접해보기 때문에 '장비를 정지합니다' 같은 대사만 알고 있었는데...
성우만 이상했을 뿐, 모든 것이 완벽한 게임이었습니다.
아 한 가지 주의할 점은 캐릭터의 신발이 미끄러운 건지 바닥이 미끄러운 건지 모르겠지만, 굉장히 미끄러집니다. 점프해서 올라가는 구간이 있으면 잘못 슬라이딩해서 황천길 급행 편도를 끊을 수 있으니 조심하세요.
그리고 또 한 가지... (여기서 완벽한 게임이라는 타이틀은 떼어내야 할 것 같지만) 고나크의 레어에서 버그가 좀 있습니다. 고나크가 거미줄 위로 안 내려오는 현상인데 이거는 나중에 게임 불러오기 해서 하면 내려오더라고요.
성우, 슬라이딩, 고나크 세 가지만 조심하면 굉장히 재밌는 게임입니다.
Оказывается в этой игре есть крутой соундтрек, выпиленный проклятыми пиратами!

Half-Life - это не забываемая игра, которую можна перепроходить не один раз, и это вам будет только радостю вернутся в просторы Черной Мезы, поиграть за физика Гордона Фримена. Игра в своё время получила множество наград.

[h1]АТМОСФЕРА[/h1]
В Half-Life атмосферу невозможно передать словами. Они передали атмосферу на высшем уровне. Каждое место имеет свою атмосферу.

[h1]СЮЖЕТ[/h1]
Сюжет росказывает нам о главном герое Гордона Фримена, который опаздывает на роботу, и его ждет експеримент с инопланетным кристалом, после ищем всеми любимую монтировку и идем убивать монстров и миролюбивых солдат. Большая часть игры проходит в Черной Мезе, а последняя часть игры проходит в мной не любимом, очень не любимом месте мир Ксен. Во время прохождения игры вам будет появлятся он самый - G-man со своим чемоданчиком, в конце-концов  в конце он предложит вам роботу. Сюжет здесь как по мне очень даже хорош.

[h1]ГРАФИКА[/h1]
Графика здесь отличная для своего времени. Жаль что для некоторых: "Графика г♥♥♥о - игра г♥♥♥о" В этой игре все на высшем уровне.

[h1]ИТОГ[/h1]
Если вы ище не купили эту игру-покупайте. Эту игру нельзя оценить никакой оценкой, но все же:
10/10
Мой донор счастья.

I first played Half-Life whilst I was working for my PhD when the game first came out. I absolutely loved it. It changed the fps gaming forever. I recently repurchased it having completed the, for me at least, disappointing Half-Life 2. The original Half Life is challenging and fascinating; its story has depth and unlike HL2, it is not just endless gunplay.  There are a number of elements here that make this game a supreme classic. I say that despite more recent great improvements in rendering and game physics. Now, sixteen years later, some of the graphics seem a little primitive – there is only three of four faces (and voices) that return over and over again despite having been killed several times over – but this is of little consequence when the game is so inventive.  

Let me give a couple of examples: Exploring Black Mesa is a joy. It is vast and labyrinthine and you are given time and space to explore its dark secrets without constantly having to fight off enemies.  Often you can use stealth in order to progress rather than wading in all the time firing both barrels. Creeping up behind and dispatching an enemy without alerting his comrades takes skill and courage; sniping your opponents with the crossbow rather than getting into a bloody fire-fight is extremely satisfying.  The pace of the game is thus perfect. You are given time to breath before moving on to the next scenario. The story also is very well conceived.  This is very rare and certainly not the case for HL2. [Spoiler alert] You assume, as you work your way through the beginning of the original Half Life, that the soldiers are there to rescue you from the invading aliens. The first time I played it I was genuinely shocked when this transpired not to be the case (my naivety I suppose). This story also makes sense and more is revealed as you continue along its path. It is also hugely inventive. The alien land Xen is really alien. Gravity works differently here (very impressively) and the alien machinery bares no recognisable relationship to human machines – I’m thinking here about the butterflies flying to the beams to open the portal. This is amazing to look at and experience and makes travelling through and exploring this world a real delight. The floating islands (reminiscent of Roger Dene’s artwork for the Yes albums) are fantastic – in the every sense of that word. Playing it again now all these years later again filled me with a great sense of adventure and was a truly satisfying experience.  This game, unlike its successor, must certainly rank as one of the greatest games ever created. I would recommend it to everybody. It will be interesting to see what, if anything, will emerge with the release of Half Life 3.
Gordon Freeman 10/10

Way more fun than I remember. Back int the day I used a Pentium 200 w/VooDoo 1 card, Now an AMD quad core & AMD R9 270. 

Anyway the combat is not as good as new AI in Counter Strikes......... but still a lot of fun & it has been so long since i played there is advenure at every corner.

I sprung for the Valve COMPLETE pack on sale for $25, I am set for entertainment for the next few years & even 10-15  year old PCs can run any of them just fine.  Anyway I have more fun with this than I do with BF4, raphics make no diff, quality story telling does.

This game is fundemental to play if you call yourself a PC game. If you have not already bought this game, do it. Now.
This game is easy to get a hold of, as it is on steam, easy to play, it uses basic controls (WASD to directionaly walk etc.), it's easy to run and has one of the best stories you will ever see in a game. 

The Drawbacks
as this game was made in 1998 the visuals are not up to par with something like Planet Side 2 or Crysis, this is easily fixable as the game has a large modding community.

This game has accomplished not only having a great story, but also fun and addicting gameplay. Which, as seen by today's games, is no small feat.

I would reccomend this game to anyone who wants to be a PC gamer to get a feel of what the PC platform is like.

You're a 27 year old nerd that can:

Take down the entire U.S. military,
Kill innocent scientists with no remorse,
Carry many weapons, including a rocket launcher, on your back,
Move at the speed of light by pushing/pulling a box,
Move at the speed of light by jumping while looking left and right,
Kill a great alien leader.

It's safe to say that this dude is more badass than all the Call of Duty protagonists combined.

Español:

Este juego a sido lo que le ha dado la vida a los Shooters, se podría decir que es el padre de todos los Shooters.

Eres Gordon Freeman, un cientifico  que trabaja en el centro de investigaciones de Black Mesa, que supuestamente esta situado en Nuevo México. Tras aparecer en un tren y que suene la voz de una mujer diciendo que son las 8:47 de la mañana dices: "Coño!, que llego tarde al trabajo!, tras 8 minutos de viaje (?) llegas a tu zona de trabajo, y todos te empiezan a sofocar diciendote: "GORDON!, NO DEBERIAS ESTAR EN LA CAMARA DE PRUEBAS" y tras 29389483881284858389219395921093 palabras identicas a esas llegas al lugar donde coges el traje de protección Mark IV, despúes de eso vuelves y te diriges hacia la camara de pruebas, donde todo parece estar correctamente, peeeeeeero, después pasa algo y todo se convierte en chocapic.
Más tarde Gordon se encuentra con Aliens, si, Aliens, como lo leeis xD, intentando llegar a la superficie para pedir ayuda, Se encuentra con que los militares han llegado a las instalaciones, y vienen en plan Terminator diciento: "NO HAY TESTIGOS", lo que el gobierno queria tapar lo que habia pasado ahí, pero tras mucho tiempo en agua, presas, y barrancos mega pros, llegas a... pero que cojones haceis con vuestras vidas, ahí hay un botón de Añadir al carro muy bonito y reluciente, la cosa esque este juego es una obra de arte, una leyenda, y teneis que jugarlo vosotros mismos para sentir la emoción, moved el culo (o la mano también xD) y compradlo, os prometo que no os arrepentireis, saludos c: .

English:

This was the game that has given life to Shooters, you could say he is the father of all Shooters.

You are Gordon Freeman, a scientist working at the research center Black Mesa, which supposedly is located in New Mexico. After appearing on a train and sound the voice of a woman claiming to be 8:47 in the morning you say: (?) "Damn !, I'm late to work !, after 8 minutes drive get to your workspace and everyone will begin to suffocate saying: "YOU SHOULD NOT BE IN THE TEST CHAMBER?" and after 29389483881284858389219395921093 words identical to those run to where you take the protective suit Mark IV, after that go back and head to the test chamber, where everything seems to be correct, buuuuuuut, then something happens and everything turnes in
Chocapic.
Later Gordon meets Aliens, yes, Aliens, yep, Aliens xD, trying to reach the surface for help, He meets the military has come to the facility, and come in Terminator plan I diciento: "NO WITNESSES" what the government wanted to cover up what had happened there, but after a long time in water, dams, mega ravines and pros, run ... but what the fuck are u doing with your life, there's a button Add to trolley nice shiny, things esque this game is a work of art, a legend, and you have to play it yourself to feel the emotion, moved the ass (or hand too xD) and buy it, I promise that you will not be sorry, greetings c: .

Going thorugh chapters through Half Life kinda might be difficult for me or you, but it's still fantastic with it's game-breaking rules and physics of Gordon Freeman. I highly suggest to get this game than the Source version. This game has the bestest storyline in game history. Me, while playing this, changed my life about anything. You don't need a Master Chief suit to kill aliens with your heavy alien-looking gun, you can just kill them by using any physical talents you have and just a crowbar. You do need this game! I am planning to buy Black Mesa Source, but I now know the storyline, the graphics and everything else too! So go out there and get a job to get 10 dollars and buy this game TODAY!

Being new to the world of PC gaming, i had to see what all this hype about the Half-Life series was. I was immediately blown away. For a game to be released in 1998 and still be played and downloaded 17 years later is a whole other achievement on its own. Either way, the gameplay is phenominal for a game of its time and the story is even better. I have just stepped into the Half-Life world and i don't see myself stepping out of it for a while. If you haven't played this game yet, i highly reccomend that you do.
i love it

Also, Half-Life. Ein Spiel aus dem Jahre 1998. Lohnt es sich überhaupt so ein Spiel zu spielen? Ist die Graphik überhaupt zu ertragen?

In meinem Fall kann ich sagen: JA!
Wir spielen Gordon Freeman, einen Wissenschaftler in Black Mesa, als eine Alien-Invasion losbricht und kämpfen uns, zu Beginn nur mit einem Brecheisen (später mehr Waffen) durch die Alien-Massen. Und dabei wird auf die individuelle Weise von Half-Life die Geschichte erzählt. Keine Cutscenes, keine erklärenden Texte. Du BIST Grodon Freeman das ganze Spiel lang.

Graphisch gesehen ist Half-Life natürlich nicht mehr mit aktuellen Titeln vergleichbar. Aber anders als andere Retro-Titel, wirkt die Graphik trotz des Alters noch recht modern. Ist also durchaus spielbar.
Half-Life zeigt auch mal wieder, dass Graphik nicht alles ist.

Wenn man mit der Half-Life Serie beginnen will lautet meine Empfehlung: JA. der erste titel ist durchaus empfehlenswert.
Sin duda una obra maestra.

[b]You probably full of reading the pros so let me list the cons:[/b]
[list]
[*] Shotgun is absolutely terrible even medium range. Get close and it is a beast of a gun.
[*] Rifle's spread is insane, long range fights take 50 bullets instead of 15 in close quarters.
[*] Pistol and Rifle ammo are shared, which removes significant liberty once you run out.
[*] Probably a bug, the crowbar stops swinging after a first hit. Very bad killing Headcrabs.
[*] Some things you must do are not that obvious, forcing you to check guides to progress.
[*] Grenade throwing feels weird somehow. I only kinda got the hang of it at the very end.
[*] Movement is slippery vs modern day games. Acceleration is also very high.
[*] You cannot have more than two NPC's following you.
[*] Army units are bullet sponges on hard.
[*] Xen is frustrating for the lack of ammo.
[/list]

[b]Now for some pros I feel I must stress:[/b]
[list]
[*] You can save some colleagues and there are dialogs when they meet other friendlies.
[*] The game is long, with a nice story stitched out behind it, which is told as you move on.
[*] The player is mute. This is more of a preference than a pro, yet I'd say it fits brilliantly.
[*] The game always introduces you to new enemies and situations with ease.
[*] When you feel comfortable with certain enemies, the game throw you a new challenge.
[*] You never really feel safe with sudden appearances of enemies in front or behind you.
[*] You vs Aliens vs Humans in a three-way fight is very cool to have.
[*] HD Pack to improve textures (I always play without though).
[*] Has a Source remake named Black Mesa, yet it is still a joy to play this one.
[*] Has easter eggs and the good old secret stashes, but not stupidly well hidden ones.
[/list]

[h1] Как любимая книга в библиотеке	[/h1]
Я бы хотел обратиться к тем любителям шутеров от первого лица, кто ещё не играл в серию Half-Life. В этой игре есть всё что можно полюбить с первого прохождения: сюжет, разнообразие локаций, геймплей, слилизация... Не сомневайтесь в своём выборе - перед вами ИГРА ГОДА 1998 по версии многих изданий. Почему? Сейчас трудно об этом судить. Первый раз я играл в Half-Life 15 лет назад и она взорвала моё представление о шутерах.

A landmark title that set the bar for interactive and immersive storytelling in games at the time, coupled with a fantastic setting, a large array of both mundane and exotic weaponry, and a whole research facility full of deadly foes to use them on.  

The soldiers are the star of the show here with their simple but effective tactics: There's nothing like taking cover to reload and seeing 3 grenades flying towards you with pinpoint accuracy.

7.8/10

La légende, par VALVe.
Un FPS linéaire mêlant des phases de combat contre des parasites, aliens, et même des soldats lourdement armés qui ne vous laisseront aucun répit.
Un Jeu ayant un bon compromis pour la difficulté "normale" (certains diront pour l'époque) offrant entre un aspect de survie, de gunfight, de découvertes, d'énigmes et une conclusion surprenante (ou deux, maiiiiis...) qui laisse sur la faim.
Il titolo parla da se, la storia dei videogiochi. Unica pecca, parere personale, è il gameplay, di cui si sente fin troppo l'età

Sorry... Half-Life is boring by 2015 standards.

I got this game so excited to play it and was so disappointed. It's just outdated not for somebody who hasn't ever played it before. My friends who played it when it came out love it to death, but I just can't get into it. My bar is set higher, I guess. The action is really slow and the weapons are clunky.

It also never ends. Given, I was a bit bored, but I thought it was almost over and was excited to be done, finally. Then I discovered there were many more levels still to go! Parts were very good, but I found myself really bored playing it, and really hating that I was making myself play it just because of the fact that it was the legendary Half-Life. I think I have two or three more levels still to go... I'm not even sure. And I took a step back and asked myself: what is this? The things I'm doing aren't fun. They were not fun.

Some specific complaints: There's a lot of tedious wandering around the confusing levels. The assault rifle seems to do no damage. There are many weapons, but I only used a few. There is not a lot of variation. The enemies take a lot of rounds to go down. Your vitals and energy being recharged is weird. There is not a whole lot of plot. The human soldiers are all played by the same voice actor, which is actually pretty funny. Dialogue is really cheesy in a game with such high standards. I got stuck a lot, making me very frustrated and upset and usually made me quit or look up the solution online, which is never fun. Big shoutout to my man, Big Mac Davis on youtube, for his level walkthroughs, I couldn't have done it without you.

This review is not meant to be an attack on Half-Life fans, it's just a perspective from someone that is probably shared by most of the people who have never played it before.

If you still want to play Half-Life, consider Black Mesa, expecially if you already have an application it'll work with. Look up Black Mesa! It is basically a redux of HL with enhanced visuals and gameplay. The story is identical.

Beautifully made. I'm amazed that it was made before the year 2000.
Weapons are cool, game is challenging but still completable, environments are fascinating and the enemies creative.
The storyline is somewhat typical, but varies enough not to be mistaken for another game.
A must have. Buy the half-life bundle when it goes on sale! I got it for 25% of the normal price, and it's one of the best decisions I've made in a while.
I rate it 1587/10. Sorry, head crab got in the way. 9.5/10. Not sure what that extra 0.5 is, but I know there's probably something that would have perfected the game.

This game is amazing. I could explain them all, but it would probably fill up the whole page. So, I'll explain each chapter, and what makes them great.
Black Mesa Inbound: TRAIN RIDES
Anomalous Materials: Shows you the norm, so when things go crazy, IT IS CRAZY. Also a  badass song
Unforseen Consequences: CRAZY STUFF. Also, CROWBARS!
Office Complex: IDK, but I love this chapter for some reason.
We got hostiles!: MARINES AND GUNS!
Blast PIt: Um... Puzzles?
Power Up: More puzzles.
On a rail: MORE TRAIN RIDES.
Apprehension:  Shark thingys
Residue Processing: Um, green stuff.
Questionable Ethics: Possibly my favorite chapter, find out Black Mesa's secrets, AND GET A AWESOME WEAPON!
Surface Tension: MORE MARINES
FORGET ABOUT FREEMAN: To the Lambda Core!
Lambda Core: Teleporting thingys
Xen: Small chapter, scary place.
Gonarch's Lair: Yes, we all know what it looks like.
Interloper: Basically a filler, nothing much.
Nilhilath: A boss battle like you've never seen before.
End Game: Good ending to a good game.
Anyway I give this game a 9/10. A must play.

Wow, umm... Holy crap. This game was amazing. It quickly became one of my favourites and I was honestly surprised at how good it was. First off, I'm not entirely sure but you may want to check out Half-Life: Source instead as It's the same game with Valve's usual engine and I believe better graphics. Most of negative reviews complain about the graphics but if you play a game from 1998 and expect it to look like Playstation 17 graphics, seek help. The graphics honestly don't effect this game and it's story and if you want to call yourself a "Gamer" you will play this. Take it from me! You'll love it! 9/10

Half-Life is an amazing game. I am not usually a huge fan of first person shooters but I think some are very good. Like this one. THIS GAME IS AMAZING! It is so cool! It has good story, cool weapons, and lots of fun! If you have Steam, there is no reason for you to not have this game.

Execisivamente inmersivo. Con tán pocos requerimientos es una obra maestra que nadie debe dejar pasar, es obvio que la calidad gráfica deja a nuestros días algo que desear, pero con tantos mods en la red creo que este aspecto puede ser facilmente satisfecho. 10/10
Es recomendable jugar el juego con una idea del mismo un tanto sobrecogedora, captando que lo que vas a jugar, (un juego de 1998), salió ya hace mas de  15 años. Hay que tratar de no ser pretenciosos a la hora de jugar esta maravilla.
PD. Tiene un nivel de dificultad muy aceptable en el nivel alto, estó si te gustan los retos te hará el juego más entretenido.

O primeiro contato que tive com o jogo foi no começo dos anos 2000, quando um de meus parentes se enjou do jogo e me presenteou com ele. Curiosamente tive a sorte de ganhar a CD-ROM de Team Fortress: Classic, Opposing Force e Conter Strike (provavelmente o 1.6), cheguei a ter as embalagens e manuais também. Hoje tenho todos os CD-ROM com excessão de CS, mas não pude joga-los devido a falta da CD-Key. *Sigh* 
     Esse ano decidi comprar o jogo na Steam e tive um bela surpresa, ele é melhor do que eu me lembrava. A história é certamente perfeita: complexa no entanto é executada de maneira simplória. Não existem cut-scenes no jogo para te atrapalhar, apenas dialogos e a bela introdução do jogo. Os personagens em sua maioria não são tão marcantes, mas trazem informações úteis pro andamento do jogo. Alguns são memoráveis como G-Man por exemplo. 
     A jogabilidade é totalmente simples. Fiquei meio invergonhado de ter feito o torturial da training room, mas foi útil no fim de tudo pricipalmente no capitulo 15: Xen. O Jogo marcou 1998 e marcou minha vida. Recomendo para todo fã de jogos de tiro em primeira pessoa, e para todo amante de video-games.
my wallet is now paper thin 'cause crack is cheaper
Han pasado 16 años y sigue siendo un juegazo, simplón con poco detalles gráficos pero la rapidez con la que se mueve el personaje y lo arcade lo hacen genial. Un 10,
Ооооооооооооооооччееень хорошая игра!

Right Half Life, the game that has had worldwide acclaim at being one of the best games ever made. There is no denying that it had left a huge impact in gaming culture but does it still hold up to this day?

The answer is: Mostly

The game is great, a real blast to play. The story is menacing and top notch, the atmosphere is just fantastic and the pacing is really good. Now here is where I think the game is a little outdated. The combat I will admit is fun but I found it sometimes a bit jittery compared to something like Return to Caslte Wolfenstein which I played beforehand. It is still good combat but I was just spoiled with RtCW to fully enjoy it. 

The puzzles I am honestly a bit mixed about. On the one hand they can be fun, I do remember some cool puzzles but other times it can get fustrating like with the platforming. There was this one puzzle where I had to activate a fan and use the fan to lift myself to get to the chute in the ceiling. I had to look at that one up. Am I stupid or is that just flawed game design? Please reply whether that kind of logic is viable?

Visually it's nice whether you're using the HD texture pack or not. The music for what little there is pretty good and odd at the same time. I also encountered a couple of glitches such as missing sound and this one time I would just die by pressing this button.

Okay so overall it is still great and I would recommend it dearly but there are just a couple of certain aspects I think people these days seem to sort of forget or forgive which is not a bad thing but I think we have to at least acknowledge their existence. Sorry for sounding so negative. Consider this as a modern perspective of a classic. I give it an 8/10
